description: Good concentration and a classic Oregon Pinot mix of herb and fruit characterize this winning effort. Dried herb, thistle, berry, cherry and a Dr. Pepper streak are all in the mix, with hints of earth and stem.
title: Blakeslee 2009 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pineapple fruit rings out loud and clear, with a slightly grainy, though not sweet, entrance. A blocky but powerfully fruity Riesling, with overtones of orange peel and black tea.
title: Wine Out West 2010 Gone Fishin' Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dark-berry fruits, tomato and herbs make for a bouquet with ample power and varietal correctness. Big, blocky and fiercely tannic, this Cabernet tastes of roasted black fruits. A finish with heat, spice, oak-based clove and mint notes confirms a high level of oak that for the most part this can handle.
title: Chakana 2014 Maipe Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Dry and a little unripe, this has a vegetal streak that compromises the nectarine and citrus flavors. A fine burst of acidity makes the mouth water. The blend is mainly Sémillon, with a little Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Palazzo Wine 2011 Cuvée Blanc White (Napa Valley)

description: More flavorful than the rather light color might indicate, this sophisticated wine has wonderful, complex aromas like leather, tea and chocolate. Vibrant flavors of raspberry and pomegranate partner with an appetizingly dry and slightly tannic texture. It is medium to full bodied.
title: Sol Rouge 2012 Mourvèdre (Red Hills Lake County)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah are combined to produce a rich, creamy red wine with milk chocolate, blueberry and exotic spice. Emilio Primo is rich, plush and soft in the mouth.
title: Terre del Marchesato 2009 Emilio Primo Red (Toscana)

description: For a Valencia D.O. wine, this is darn appealing. The nose is warm, rooty and smells of cola nut, fresh raisins and cassis, while the driving palate offers roasted black fruit flavors along with sweet tomato and herbs. Drying and tannic on the finish, but balanced. Neither cooked nor overweight. Drink now through 2011.
title: Venta del Puerto 2006 N° 12 Selección Especial Red (Valencia)

description: The wine is crisp, full of red berry fruit and lively acidity, with a smooth texture. This is terrific as an accompaniment to a summer meal or as an apéritif. The finish is deliciously fruity. Screwcap.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis 2011 Terres de Saint-Lion Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: A scintillating scent of rose petals opens up this pleasing wine, which continues with raspberry and cherry fruit, accented with light milk chocolate. It is not a heavy wine; in fact, if Franc can ever be called elegant, even feminine, this is how it should taste. The finish falls off rather quickly, but otherwise it is a fine effort.
title: Columbia Crest 2005 Beverly Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This delivers inky dark, brooding aromas of black fruit, dark spice, molasses, resin, tar and cured meat. The mouthfeel is soft and chewy, with a sticky mocha flavor and a spicy endnote of barbecue spice.
title: Musella 2007 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This blend of 60% Syrah, 25% Grenache and 15% Mourvèdre is plush and brooding, with dense aromas and flavors of macerated blackberry, black plum and boysenberry that are laced with hints of bramble, violet and baking spice. The medium-weight palate boasts approachable tannins, ripe black-fruit flavors and a crushed satin texture. Notes of black tea, pepper and licorice grace the long finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Fable Mountain 2012 Night Sky Red (Coastal Region)

description: This is a robustly reduced, tightly wound and still quite youthful wine, showing both the vintage and the appellation in warmer years, with an intensity of black tea, tar and black cherry. Full bodied, it's powerfully weighted and structured.
title: MacPhail 2013 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: This Rhône-style blend is simple and fruity. The flavors of cherry jam, caramel and oak are balanced with acidity and smooth tannins. Sausages are a natural companion.
title: Larner 2010 Elemental G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Easy drinking Cabernet here, with soft, gentle tannins framing sweet blackberries, mocha and smoky oak. Not an ager, so enjoy now.
title: Stickybeak 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Straightforward and fresh, this opens with aromas of jasmine and exotic fruit. The round, juicy palate is reminiscent of citrus, pineapple and pear while a note of bitter almond adds interest.
title: Taba 2015 F  (Falanghina del Sannio)
